function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Data collected during the initial testing period may be affected by the learning phase of individuals"},{"name":"Expansion to a drive-through environment introduces new time measures and operational differences"},{"name":"Addition of new smartphones to digitalize a larger clinic introduces scalability and data management challenges."},{"name":"Mass vaccination process against covid-19"},{"name":"High efficiency of the vaccination process"},{"name":"Use of smartphone application with nfc technology"},{"name":"Long queue at the beginning of the day in the inoculation phase"},{"name":"Increased flow of patients leading to crowded moments"},{"name":"High utilization of doctors in the anamnesis control phase"},{"name":"Queues before and after inoculation phase could lead to potential overcrowding and spread of contagious diseases in the waiting area."},{"name":"Mean and maximum values of the queue indicate higher patient congestion after inoculation, increasing the risk of disease transmission."},{"name":"Constant wait time of 15 minutes for post-inoculation waiting may result in patients being in close proximity for an extended period, increasing the risk of disease transmission."},{"name":"High patient density in queue"},{"name":"High resource utilization"},{"name":"Data collection and analysis from 10 smartphones"},{"name":"High interarrival time leading to fewer patients vaccinated"},{"name":"Exceeding layout boundaries"},{"name":"Overutilization of resources in anamnesis, inoculation, and registration"},{"name":"High variability in time between arrivals"},{"name":"Unbalanced integration of different types of resources"},{"name":"Overcrowding and bottleneck due to excessive number of doctors"},{"name":"Testing mobile application in a smaller clinic may result in potential exposure to contagious diseases for the operators and patients."},{"name":"Expansion of the digital twin framework to a bigger case may involve the introduction of new smartphones and badges, leading to potential risks of contamination and disease spread."},{"name":"Implementing a digital twin for each specific clinic due to non-linear relationships between clinic size and configuration may result in increased resource and time investment for implementation."},{"name":"High probability of individuals having a body temperature lower than 37.5 c"},{"name":"Limited space for mass vaccination clinic"},{"name":"Inadequate anamnesis and rejection probability"},{"name":"Elderly people taking more time for forms fill-in and vaccine inoculation"},{"name":"Probability differences between adults and elderly people"},{"name":"Time measurements and distributions for vaccination process parameters"},{"name":"Use of physical system data in virtual system"},{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases through physical system data handling"},{"name":"Inadequate sanitation of physical system data"},{"name":"Operators sharing data without proper sanitation or protection measures"},{"name":"Inaccurate translation of unix time stamp into date and time"},{"name":"Replicating solutions in the physical system without proper testing"},{"name":"Use of shared badges by multiple patients can lead to indirect contact and potential transmission of contagious diseases."},{"name":"Proximity-based data transfer through nfc technology can lead to the spread of contagious diseases if the smartphones and badges are not properly sanitized."},{"name":"Lack of visibility into the number of patients and their contact with the badges increases the difficulty of contact tracing and containment of contagious diseases."},{"name":"Automation failure in data collection leading to inaccurate time values"},{"name":"Inadequate mapping of the real process due to incomplete or unreliable data"},{"name":"Resource overutilization leading to employee burnout and dissatisfaction"},{"name":"Patient arrival inside the system may introduce contagious individuals into the environment."},{"name":"Queue and waiting areas may facilitate close contact between individuals, increasing the risk of disease transmission."},{"name":"Inoculation and treatment phases may lead to potential exposure to contaminated materials or infected individuals."},{"name":"Inadequate vaccination process flowchart"},{"name":"Insufficient representation of resources in the simulation model"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for dynamic factors in the simulation model"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to the entry of infected individuals into the clinic"},{"name":"Possibility of undetected contagious individuals entering the vaccination process"}]}
